title: Social Education Innovation Project Through Teacher-AI Collaboration: Civic Competency Strengthening Model

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level social studies education theories (history, geography, economics, politics, culture domains) and proficiency in high-level AI applications
context.additional_context: Project for in-service social studies teachers to collaboratively develop lesson design and operational strategies using AI tools, with a focus on strengthening civic competencies (critical thinking, decision-making, social responsibility).

learning_goals: Teachers will explain six strategies for optimizing social studies lesson design through AI collaboration, including social issue analysis and civic competency activities.

Learners will analyze two ethical issues (e.g., bias, privacy violations) and two technical limitations (e.g., data errors, ambiguous interpretations) in three AI collaboration scenarios (e.g., hiring fairness, community conflict resolution, multicultural policy design). They will propose â‰¥1 feasible alternative (e.g., audit systems, human oversight) per issue.

Learners will design a teacher-AI collaboration model based on real social studies cases (e.g., history projects, geography analysis, economic simulations) and implement it using a PBL (Problem-Based Learning) approach.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
